info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 06 at 5:57PM CDT until August 06 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ELMORE...WESTERN LEE AND MACON COUNTIES... At 557 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Oak Bowery to near Tuskegee to near Blue Ridge, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Auburn, Opelika, Tuskegee, Tallassee, Notasulga, Milstead, Shorter, Franklin, Waverly, Lake Tuskegee, Auburn University, Emerald Mountain, Tuskegee National Forest, Beauregard, Davisville, Liverpool, Hardaway, Tysonville, Victoryland and Society Hill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
